meta.name: ND-5000/5800 Microcode Definition
meta.source: ND-05.022.1 Reference Manual Appendix A, MICROCODE-FIELDS.md
meta.notes: 16 bytes per microcode word, byte 0 = bits 127-120. All values include complete enumeration of valid field values with mnemonics and descriptions.

ALU_TRUE.description: ALU operation when condition is true (4-bit ALU + 2-bit carry)

2.description: LOGICAL AND OF A AND B

3.description: LOGICAL AND OF A AND B COMPLEMENTED

4.description: A OPERAND DIRECT THROUGH THE ALU

5.description: LOGICAL EXCLUSIVE OR OF A AND B

6.description: LOGICAL AND OF A COMPLEMENTED AND B

7.description: LOGICAL OR OF A AND B

10.description: A MINUS B OPERAND (carry selects -1 or +C)

14.description: B OPERAND MINUS A OPERAND (carry selects -1 or +C)

ALU_FALSE.description: ALU operation when condition is false (4-bit ALU + 2-bit carry)

2.description: LOGICAL AND OF A AND B

3.description: LOGICAL AND OF A AND B COMPLEMENTED

4.description: A OPERAND DIRECT THROUGH THE ALU

5.description: LOGICAL EXCLUSIVE OR OF A AND B

6.description: LOGICAL AND OF A COMPLEMENTED AND B

7.description: LOGICAL OR OF A AND B

10.description: A MINUS B OPERAND (carry selects -1 or +C)

14.description: B OPERAND MINUS A OPERAND (carry selects -1 or +C)

EXUC.description: Execute unconditional - for sneak instructions during pipeline breaks

1.description: ALU selects function based on condition

4.description: Q <- Q/2; Q(SIGN.BIT) <- Q(SIGN.BIT) (arithmetic shift right)

30.description: COPY A TO F / RESET AAP

7.description: B TIMES NEGATIVE VALUE OF A

11.description: A TIMES NEGATIVE VALUE OF B

13.description: NEGATIVE VALUE OF A TIMES B

1.description: DATA TYPE IS SINGLE FLOATING (32 bits)

2.description: DATA TYPE IS HALF WORD (16 bits)

5.description: DATA TYPE IS DOUBLE FLOATING (64 bits)

6.description: DATA TYPE IS 128 BITS FLOATING POINT

OR_ENABLE.description: Enable OR control logic for operand/destination selection

A_OP.description: A-operand select (3-bit group XXX + 5-bit register ZZZZZ)

36.description: A-BUS IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A1

37.description: A-BUS IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A2

38.description: A-BUS IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A3

39.description: A-BUS IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A4

44.description: A-BUS IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E1

45.description: A-BUS IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E2

46.description: A-BUS IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E3

47.description: A-BUS IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E4

57.description: A-BUS IS BIT MASK FROM LOOP COUNTER

61.description: A-BUS IS ALU TRAP ENABLE BITS

63.description: [UNDOCUMENTED GUESS] A-BUS IS ALU REGISTER 37 - very common (674 uses), possibly special/reserved register

124.description: [UNDOCUMENTED GUESS] A-BUS IS SPEC REGISTER 34 - unknown purpose, single use with ALU,XOR at address 004615

133.description: A-BUS IS MIC TRAP ENABLE BITS

140.description: A-BUS IS REG.FILE POINTED TO BY RF1 REGISTER

141.description: A-BUS IS REG.FILE POINTED TO BY RF2 REGISTER

142.description: A-BUS IS REG.FILE POINTED TO BY RF1, RF1 DECREMENT

143.description: A-BUS IS REG.FILE POINTED TO BY RF2, RF2 DECREMENT

160.description: A-BUS IS MIC TRAP ENABLE REGISTER

163.description: A-BUS IS IDU LIMIT CONTROL REGISTER

245.description: [UNDOCUMENTED GUESS] A-BUS IS DAC TRANSFER REGISTER - used at DAC_R_SC10, DAC_R_SC6 for DAC-to-scratch transfers

4.description: B-BUS IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A1

5.description: B-BUS IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A2

6.description: B-BUS IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A3

7.description: B-BUS IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A4

12.description: B-BUS IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E1

13.description: B-BUS IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E2

14.description: B-BUS IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E3

15.description: B-BUS IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E4

4.description: DESTINATION IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A1

5.description: DESTINATION IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A2

6.description: DESTINATION IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A3

7.description: DESTINATION IS FLOATING MOST REGISTER A4

12.description: DESTINATION IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E1

13.description: DESTINATION IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E2

14.description: DESTINATION IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E3

15.description: DESTINATION IS FLOATING LEAST REGISTER E4

31.description: [UNDOCUMENTED GUESS] DESTINATION IS ALU REGISTER 37 - very common (253 uses), possibly special/reserved register

91.description: TRAP CLEAR AND UNLOCK THE DMM

107.description: TRAP CLEAR AND UNLOCK THE IMM

112.description: DESTINATION IS IMM AND DMM PSTP REGISTER

113.description: DESTINATION IS IMM AND DMM PUWP REGISTER

114.description: DESTINATION IS IMM AND DMM LA REGISTER

115.description: DESTINATION IS IMM AND DMM WR REGISTER

116.description: DESTINATION IS IMM AND DMM CAP REGISTERS

117.description: DESTINATION IS IMM AND DMM PS REGISTER

118.description: DESTINATION IS IMM AND DMM PHS REGISTER

119.description: DESTINATION IS IMM AND DMM DOM REGISTER

121.description: DESTINATION IS IMM AND DMM TSB

123.description: TRAP CLEAR AND UNLOCK THE IMM AND DMM

126.description: DESTINATION IS IMM AND DMM DIRTY-DOM-PS REGISTER

127.description: DESTINATION IS IMM AND DMM ADOM REGISTER

133.description: DESTINATION IS MIC TRAP ENABLE BITS

140.description: DESTINATION IS REG.FILE POINTED TO BY RF1 REGISTER

141.description: DESTINATION IS REG.FILE POINTED TO BY RF2 REGISTER

142.description: DESTINATION IS REG.FILE POINTED TO BY RF1, RF1 DECR.

143.description: DESTINATION IS REG.FILE POINTED TO BY RF2, RF2 DECR.

160.description: DESTINATION IS MIC TRAP ENABLE REGISTER

163.description: DESTINATION IS IDU LIMIT CONTROL REGISTER

197.description: SUM IS TRANSFERRED TO IAC Y REGISTER

227.description: SUM IS TRANSFERRED TO DAC B REGISTER

228.description: [UNDOCUMENTED GUESS] DESTINATION IS DAC REGISTER 04 - 8 occurrences

229.description: [UNDOCUMENTED GUESS] DESTINATION IS DAC REGISTER 05 - 12 occurrences

252.description: [UNDOCUMENTED GUESS] DESTINATION IS DAC LOAD RESULT REGISTER - used at LOADR, LOADCT_R, LOADRB_R with READ operations

3.description: SET K TO 1 IF ALU OPERATION IS 0

5.description: SAVE STATUS FROM ALU IN COMPARE

9.description: SAVE MIXED STATUS FOR INTEGER MULTIPLY

SEQ_TRUE.description: Sequence control when condition true (2-bit type + 2-bit stack)

SEQ_FALSE.description: Sequence control when condition false (2-bit type + 2-bit stack)

2.description: FALSE RETURN TO TOP OF STACK

INVSEQ.description: Invert test condition for sequence selection

0.description: EXOR OF S AND O FROM ALU RESULT

1.description: OR OF S AND Z FROM ALU OPERATION

2.description: OR OF S AND Z FROM STATUS (S1)

3.description: AND OF C AND NOT Z FROM ALU OPERATION

8.description: AND OF C AND NOT Z FROM STATUS (S1)

24.description: PARITY OF LEAST SIGNIFICANT BYTE OF F-BUS

26.description: TOP BIT OF SAVED CONDITION STACK

27.description: BOTTOM BIT OF SAVED CONDITION STACK

57.description: Q0 FOR ALU, LCZ FOR SEQ.

3.description: CALCULATE NEXT ADDRESS TO LINK REGISTER

0.description: CACHE WRITE NEXT INSTRUCTION STREAM ADDRESS

3.description: CACHE WRITE NPC RELATIVE JUMP ADDRESS

4.description: CACHE WRITE P RELATIVE JUMP ADDRESS
GET NEXT INSTRUCTION AND OPERAND SPECIFIER

5.description: GET NEXT INSTRUCTION AND OPERAND SPECIFIER IF TRUE

6.description: GET NEXT INSTRUCTION AND OPERAND SPECIFIER IF FALSE

7.description: GET NEXT INSTRUCTION AND OPERAND AFTER CALL

10.description: GET SECOND OR LATER OPERAND SPECIFIER

13.description: GET SECOND OPERAND SPECIFIER FOR STRING INSTR

14.description: GET NEXT INSTRUCTION CODE, FOR TESTING ONLY

15.description: SET START ADDRESS FROM IB TO LA

2.description: PERFORM A PHYSICAL WRITE WITH MMS

5.description: WRITE DATA MEMORY IN NORMAL DOMAIN

6.description: WRITE DATA MEMORY IN ALTERNATIVE DOMAIN

8.description: FORCE QVACC (USE WITH A,IAC, AND LOADLA)

9.description: PERFORM A PHYSICAL READ WITH MMS

11.description: READ DATA MEMORY, WRITE PERMIT REQUIRED

13.description: READ DATA MEMORY IN NORMAL DOMAIN

14.description: READ DATA MEMORY IN ALTERNATIVE DOMAIN

1.description: SAVE ADDRESS IN EA1 AND EAO

2.description: SAVE ADDRESS IN EA2 AND EAO

3.description: SAVE ADDRESS IN EA3 AND EAO

ABS_ADDR.description: Absolute microprogram jump address (also overlaps with long/short argument)

3.description: ADDRESS A OPERAND IS DATA REGISTER

4.description: ADDRESS A OPERAND IS EAO REGISTER

5.description: ADDRESS A OPERAND IS EA1 REGISTER

6.description: ADDRESS A OPERAND IS EA2 REGISTER

7.description: ADDRESS A OPERAND IS EA3 REGISTER

2.description: ADDRESS B OPERAND IS BASE (B) REGISTER

3.description: ADDRESS B OPERAND IS RECORD (R) REGISTER

4.description: ADDRESS B OPERAND IS INDEX REGISTER X1

5.description: ADDRESS B OPERAND IS INDEX REGISTER X2

6.description: ADDRESS B OPERAND IS INDEX REGISTER X3

7.description: ADDRESS B OPERAND IS INDEX REGISTER X4

11.description: PREVIOUS ADDRESS +4 IF RECYCLE NOT NECESSARY

12.description: DESC(X)(I1), I1 SCALED ACCORDING TO INSTRUCTION

13.description: DESC(X)(I2), I2 SCALED ACCORDING TO INSTRUCTION

14.description: DESC(X)(I3), I3 SCALED ACCORDING TO INSTRUCTION

15.description: DESC(X)(I4), I4 SCALED ACCORDING TO INSTRUCTION

1.description: ENABLE EXTENSION REGISTER IN NEXT MICRO CYCLE
OR A OPERAND FROM OPERAND SPECIFIER

3.description: OR A OPERAND FROM STRING SOURCE OPERAND

2.description: OR DESTINATION FROM FIRST OPERAND SPECIFIER
